00371 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00372 #define CVMX_HNA_SBD_DBG1 CVMX_HNA_SBD_DBG1_FUNC()
00373 static inline uint64_t CVMX_HNA_SBD_DBG1_FUNC(void)
00374 {
00375     if (!(OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X)))
00376         cvmx_warn("CVMX_HNA_SBD_DBG1 not supported on this chip\n");
00377     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180047000048ull);
00378 }
00379 #else
00380 #define CVMX_HNA_SBD_DBG1 (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180047000048ull))
00381 #endif
00382 #if CVMX_ENABLE_CSR_ADDRESS_CHECKING
00383 #define CVMX_HNA_SBD_DBG2 CVMX_HNA_SBD_DBG2_FUNC()
00384 static inline uint64_t CVMX_HNA_SBD_DBG2_FUNC(void)
00385 {

00387         cvmx_warn("CVMX_HNA_SBD_DBG2 not supported on this chip\n");
00388     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001180047000050ull);
00389 }
00390 #else

00392 #endif

00405 /**
00406  * cvmx_hna_bist0
00407  *
00408  * This register shows the result of the BIST run on the HNA (per-HPU).
00409  * 1 = BIST error, 0 = BIST passed, is in progress, or never ran.
00410  */

00420     uint64_t hpc1                         : 10; /**< BIST results for HPC1 RAM(s) (per-HPU). */
00421     uint64_t reserved_10_15               : 6;
00422     uint64_t hpc0                         : 10; /**< BIST results for HPC0 RAM(s) (per-HPU). */

00426     uint64_t hpc1                         : 10;
00427     uint64_t reserved_26_31               : 6;
00428     uint64_t hpc2                         : 10;
00429     uint64_t reserved_42_47               : 6;
00430     uint64_t hpc3                         : 10;
00431     uint64_t reserved_58_63               : 6;
00432 #endif
00433     } s;

00438     uint64_t reserved_10_15               : 6;

00501 /**
00502  * cvmx_hna_config
00503  *
00504  * This register specifies the HNA HPU programmable controls.
00505  *
00506  */
00507 union cvmx_hna_config {
00508     uint64_t u64;
00509     struct cvmx_hna_config_s {
00510 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00511     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
00512     uint64_t stk_ll_dis                   : 1;  /**< Stack linked-list disable. When set, the linked-list mechanism for run stack and save
00513                                                          stack structures is disabled. In this mode, the linked-list chunk boundary checking is not
00514                                                          done, and therefore the previous/next pointers are non-existent. The stacks are
00515                                                          effectively in an infinite linear buffer, bounded only by the maximum sizes provided in
00516                                                          the instruction (IWORD3[RUNSTACKSZ] and IWORD6[SVSTACKSZ]). There is no space reserved for
00517                                                          the previous and next pointers, and [STK_CHKSZ] is ignored.
00518                                                          When the STK_LL_DIS is cleared, the stack linked-list mechanism operates as per spec. */
00519     uint64_t reserved_23_23               : 1;
00520     uint64_t stk_chksz                    : 3;  /**< Stack chunk size. This encoded value specifies the chunk size for both the RNSTK/SVSTK
00521                                                          data structures. The RNSTK/SVSTK use a doubly linked list where each chunk's first two
00522                                                          64-bit entries contain the previous and next chunk pointers.
00523                                                          0x0 = 32 entries or 256 bytes.
00524                                                          0x1 = 64 entries or 512 bytes.
00525                                                          0x2 = 128 entries or 1K bytes.
00526                                                          0x3 = 256 entries or 2K bytes.
00527                                                          0x4 = 512 entries or 4K bytes.
00528                                                          0x5 = 1024 entries or 8K bytes.
00529                                                          0x6 = 2048 entries or 16K bytes.
00530                                                          0x7 = 4096 entries or 32K bytes.
00531                                                          NOTE: This field can only be changed at initialization/power on time before the HNA is fed
00532                                                          instructions. */
00533     uint64_t rnstk_lwm                    : 4;  /**< RNSTK low watermark. This field specifies the low watermark for the run stack. Valid
00534                                                          range: 0-15.
00535                                                          Once the run stack goes below the low watermark, HNA fills entries from the global run
00536                                                          stack head to the local run stack tail. The granularity of this field is represented as
00537                                                          number of 128B cachelines.
00538                                                          NOTE: This field can only be changed at initialization/power on time before the HNA is fed
00539                                                          instructions. */
00540     uint64_t rnstk_hwm                    : 4;  /**< RNSTK high watermark. This field specifies the high watermark for the run stack. Valid
00541                                                          range: 0-15.
00542                                                          Once the local run stack level goes above the high watermark, the HNA spills entries from
00543                                                          the local run stack tail to the global run stack head (in DDR memory). The granularity of
00544                                                          this field is represented as number of 128B cachelines.
00545                                                          NOTE: This field can only be changed at initialization/power on time before the HNA is fed
00546                                                          instructions. */
00547     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
00548     uint64_t ecccordis                    : 1;  /**< ECC correction disable. When set, all HNA ECC protected data structures disable their ECC
00549                                                          correction logic. When clear (default) ECC correction is always enabled. */
00550     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 4;  /**< Cluster cripple mask. A one in each bit of the mask represents which HPC cluster to
00551                                                          cripple.
00552                                                          MIO_FUS_DAT3[HNA_INFO_CLM] fuse bits are forced into this
00553                                                          register at reset. Any fuse bits that contain 1 are disallowed during a write and are
00554                                                          always read as 1. */
00555     uint64_t hpu_clcrip                   : 3;  /**< HPU cluster cripple. Encoding which represents number of HPUs to cripple for each
00556                                                          cluster. Typically HPU_CLCRIP=0x0, which enables all HPUs within each cluster. However,
00557                                                          when the HNA performance counters are used, software may want to limit the number of HPUs
00558                                                          per cluster available, as there are only 4 parallel performance counters.
00559                                                          0x0 = HPU[9:0]:ON, All engines enabled.
00560                                                          0x1 = HPU[9]:OFF /HPU[8:0]:ON, (n-1) engines enabled.
00561                                                          0x2 = HPU[9:8]:OFF /HPU[7:0]:ON, (n-2) engines enabled.
00562                                                          0x2 = HPU[9:7]:OFF /HPU[6:0]:ON, (n-3) engines enabled.
00563                                                          0x3 = HPU[9:6]:OFF /HPU[5:0]:ON, (n-4) engines enabled.
00564                                                          0x4 = HPU[9:5]:OFF /HPU[4:0]:ON, (n-5) engines enabled.
00565                                                          0x5 = HPU[9:4]:OFF /HPU[3:0]:ON, (n-6) engines enabled.
00566                                                          0x6 = HPU[9:2]:OFF /HPU[1:0]:ON, (n-8) engines enabled.
00567                                                          0x7 = HPU[9:1]:OFF /HPU[0]:ON, (n-9) 1 engine enabled.
00568                                                          NOTE: Higher numbered HPUs are crippled first. For instance, on CN78XX (with 10
00569                                                          HPUs/cluster), if HPU_CLCRIP=0x1, then HPU numbers [9] within the cluster are
00570                                                          crippled and only HPU numbers 0-8 are available.
00571                                                          Software NOTE: The MIO_FUS___HNA_NUMHPU_CRIPPLE[2:0] fuse bits are forced into this
00572                                                          register at reset. Any fuse bits that contain 1 are disallowed during a write and are
00573                                                          always read as 1. */
00574     uint64_t hpuclkdis                    : 1;  /**< HNA clock disable source. When set, the HNA clocks for HPU (thread engine) operation are
00575                                                          disabled (to conserve overall chip clocking power when the HNA function is not used).
00576                                                          NOTE: When set, software must never issue NCB-direct CSR operations to the HNA (will
00577                                                          result in NCB bus timeout errors).
00578                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value during power-on software
00579                                                          initialization.
00580                                                          Software NOTE: The MIO_FUS___HNA_HPU_DISABLE fuse bit is forced into this register at
00581                                                          reset. If the fuse bit contains 1, writes to HPUCLKDIS are disallowed and are always read
00582                                                          as 1. */
00583 #else
00584     uint64_t hpuclkdis                    : 1;
00585     uint64_t hpu_clcrip                   : 3;
00586     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 4;
00587     uint64_t ecccordis                    : 1;
00588     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
00589     uint64_t rnstk_hwm                    : 4;
00590     uint64_t rnstk_lwm                    : 4;
00591     uint64_t stk_chksz                    : 3;
00592     uint64_t reserved_23_23               : 1;
00593     uint64_t stk_ll_dis                   : 1;
00594     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
00595 #endif
00596     } s;
00597     struct cvmx_hna_config_cn73xx {
00598 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00599     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
00600     uint64_t stk_ll_dis                   : 1;  /**< Stack linked-list disable. When set, the linked-list mechanism for run stack and save
00601                                                          stack structures is disabled. In this mode, the linked-list chunk boundary checking is not
00602                                                          done, and therefore the previous/next pointers are non-existent. The stacks are
00603                                                          effectively in an infinite linear buffer, bounded only by the maximum sizes provided in
00604                                                          the instruction (IWORD3[RUNSTACKSZ] and IWORD6[SVSTACKSZ]). There is no space reserved for
00605                                                          the previous and next pointers, and [STK_CHKSZ] is ignored.
00606                                                          When the STK_LL_DIS is cleared, the stack linked-list mechanism operates as per spec. */
00607     uint64_t reserved_23_23               : 1;
00608     uint64_t stk_chksz                    : 3;  /**< Stack chunk size. This encoded value specifies the chunk size for both the RNSTK/SVSTK
00609                                                          data structures. The RNSTK/SVSTK use a doubly linked list where each chunk's first two
00610                                                          64-bit entries contain the previous and next chunk pointers.
00611                                                          0x0 = 32 entries or 256 bytes.
00612                                                          0x1 = 64 entries or 512 bytes.
00613                                                          0x2 = 128 entries or 1K bytes.
00614                                                          0x3 = 256 entries or 2K bytes.
00615                                                          0x4 = 512 entries or 4K bytes.
00616                                                          0x5 = 1024 entries or 8K bytes.
00617                                                          0x6 = 2048 entries or 16K bytes.
00618                                                          0x7 = 4096 entries or 32K bytes.
00619                                                          NOTE: This field can only be changed at initialization/power on time before the HNA is fed
00620                                                          instructions. */
00621     uint64_t rnstk_lwm                    : 4;  /**< RNSTK low watermark. This field specifies the low watermark for the run stack. Valid
00622                                                          range: 0-15.
00623                                                          Once the run stack goes below the low watermark, HNA fills entries from the global run
00624                                                          stack head to the local run stack tail. The granularity of this field is represented as
00625                                                          number of 128B cachelines.
00626                                                          NOTE: This field can only be changed at initialization/power on time before the HNA is fed
00627                                                          instructions. */
00628     uint64_t rnstk_hwm                    : 4;  /**< RNSTK high watermark. This field specifies the high watermark for the run stack. Valid
00629                                                          range: 0-15.
00630                                                          Once the local run stack level goes above the high watermark, the HNA spills entries from
00631                                                          the local run stack tail to the global run stack head (in DDR memory). The granularity of
00632                                                          this field is represented as number of 128B cachelines.
00633                                                          NOTE: This field can only be changed at initialization/power on time before the HNA is fed
00634                                                          instructions. */
00635     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
00636     uint64_t ecccordis                    : 1;  /**< ECC correction disable. When set, all HNA ECC protected data structures disable their ECC
00637                                                          correction logic. When clear (default) ECC correction is always enabled. */
00638     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
00639     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 2;  /**< Cluster cripple mask. A one in each bit of the mask represents which HPC cluster to
00640                                                          cripple. CN73XX HNA has 2 clusters, where all CLMSKCRIP mask bits are used.
00641                                                          MIO_FUS_DAT3[HNA_INFO_CLM] fuse bits are forced into this
00642                                                          register at reset. Any fuse bits that contain 1 are disallowed during a write and are
00643                                                          always read as 1. */
00644     uint64_t hpu_clcrip                   : 3;  /**< HPU cluster cripple. Encoding which represents number of HPUs to cripple for each
00645                                                          cluster. Typically HPU_CLCRIP=0x0, which enables all HPUs within each cluster. However,
00646                                                          when the HNA performance counters are used, software may want to limit the number of HPUs
00647                                                          per cluster available, as there are only 4 parallel performance counters.
00648                                                          0x0 = HPU[9:0]:ON, All engines enabled.
00649                                                          0x1 = HPU[9]:OFF /HPU[8:0]:ON, (n-1) engines enabled.
00650                                                          0x2 = HPU[9:8]:OFF /HPU[7:0]:ON, (n-2) engines enabled.
00651                                                          0x2 = HPU[9:7]:OFF /HPU[6:0]:ON, (n-3) engines enabled.
00652                                                          0x3 = HPU[9:6]:OFF /HPU[5:0]:ON, (n-4) engines enabled.
00653                                                          0x4 = HPU[9:5]:OFF /HPU[4:0]:ON, (n-5) engines enabled.
00654                                                          0x5 = HPU[9:4]:OFF /HPU[3:0]:ON, (n-6) engines enabled.
00655                                                          0x6 = HPU[9:2]:OFF /HPU[1:0]:ON, (n-8) engines enabled.
00656                                                          0x7 = HPU[9:1]:OFF /HPU[0]:ON, (n-9) 1 engine enabled.
00657                                                          NOTE: Higher numbered HPUs are crippled first. For instance, on CN78XX (with 10
00658                                                          HPUs/cluster), if HPU_CLCRIP=0x1, then HPU numbers [9] within the cluster are
00659                                                          crippled and only HPU numbers 0-8 are available.
00660                                                          Software NOTE: The MIO_FUS___HNA_NUMHPU_CRIPPLE[2:0] fuse bits are forced into this
00661                                                          register at reset. Any fuse bits that contain 1 are disallowed during a write and are
00662                                                          always read as 1. */
00663     uint64_t hpuclkdis                    : 1;  /**< HNA clock disable source. When set, the HNA clocks for HPU (thread engine) operation are
00664                                                          disabled (to conserve overall chip clocking power when the HNA function is not used).
00665                                                          NOTE: When set, software must never issue NCB-direct CSR operations to the HNA (will
00666                                                          result in NCB bus timeout errors).
00667                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value during power-on software
00668                                                          initialization.
00669                                                          Software NOTE: The MIO_FUS___HNA_HPU_DISABLE fuse bit is forced into this register at
00670                                                          reset. If the fuse bit contains 1, writes to HPUCLKDIS are disallowed and are always read
00671                                                          as 1. */
00672 #else
00673     uint64_t hpuclkdis                    : 1;
00674     uint64_t hpu_clcrip                   : 3;
00675     uint64_t clmskcrip                    : 2;
00676     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
00677     uint64_t ecccordis                    : 1;
00678     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
00679     uint64_t rnstk_hwm                    : 4;
00680     uint64_t rnstk_lwm                    : 4;
00681     uint64_t stk_chksz                    : 3;
00682     uint64_t reserved_23_23               : 1;
00683     uint64_t stk_ll_dis                   : 1;
00684     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
00685 #endif
00686     } cn73xx;
00687     struct cvmx_hna_config_s              cn78xx;
00688     struct cvmx_hna_config_s              cn78xxp1;
00689 };
00690 typedef union cvmx_hna_config cvmx_hna_config_t;
00691 
00692 /**
00693  * cvmx_hna_control
00694  *
00695  * This register specifies the HNA CTL/HNC programmable controls.
00696  *
00697  */
00698 union cvmx_hna_control {
00699     uint64_t u64;
00700     struct cvmx_hna_control_s {
00701 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00702     uint64_t reserved_13_63               : 51;
00703     uint64_t frcperr                      : 1;  /**< Force parity error during an OCM load. When set, a parity error is forced during the OCM
00704                                                          load instruction. Software can force a single line to contain a parity error by setting
00705                                                          this bit and performance a OCM load for a single line (DLEN=32), then clearing the bit. */
00706     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 6;  /**< Reserved. SBD debug entry number. */
00707     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;  /**< Reserved. HNA scoreboard lock strobe. */
00708     uint64_t reserved_3_4                 : 2;
00709     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;  /**< Reserved. NCB-NRP arbiter mode. (0=fixed priority [LP=DFF,HP=RGF]/1=RR
00710                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value during power-on software
00711                                                          initialization. */
00712     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;  /**< Reserved. NCB-NRQ arbiter mode. 0 = Fixed priority (LP = NPF, IRF, WRF, PRF, RSRF, HP =
00713                                                          SLL); 1 = Round robin.
00714                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value during power-on software
00715                                                          initialization. */
00716     uint64_t imode                        : 1;  /**< Reserved. NCB-inbound arbiter. 0 = Fixed priority (LP = NRQ, HP = NRP); 1 = Round robin).
00717                                                          NOTE: This should only be written to a different value during power-on software
00718                                                          initialization. */
00719 #else
00720     uint64_t imode                        : 1;
00721     uint64_t qmode                        : 1;
00722     uint64_t pmode                        : 1;
00723     uint64_t reserved_3_4                 : 2;
00724     uint64_t sbdlck                       : 1;
00725     uint64_t sbdnum                       : 6;
00726     uint64_t frcperr                      : 1;
00727     uint64_t reserved_13_63               : 51;
00728 #endif
00729     } s;
00730     struct cvmx_hna_control_s             cn73xx;
00731     struct cvmx_hna_control_s             cn78xx;
00732     struct cvmx_hna_control_s             cn78xxp1;
00733 };
00734 typedef union cvmx_hna_control cvmx_hna_control_t;
00735 
00736 /**
00737  * cvmx_hna_dbell
00738  *
00739  * To write to the HNA_DBELL register, a device issues an IOBST directed at the HNA with
00740  * addr[34:32] = 0x0 or 0x1. To read the HNA_DBELL register, a device issues an IOBLD64 directed
00741  * at the HNA with addr[34:32] = 0x0 or 0x1.
00742  *
00743  * If HNA_CONFIG[HPUCLKDIS]=1 (HNA-HPU clocks disabled), reads/writes to the HNA_DBELL register
00744  * do not take effect. If the HNA-disable fuse is blown, reads/writes to the HNA_DBELL register
00745  * do not take effect.
00746  */
00747 union cvmx_hna_dbell {
00748     uint64_t u64;
00749     struct cvmx_hna_dbell_s {
00750 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00751     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
00752     uint64_t dbell                        : 20; /**< Represents the cumulative total of pending HNA instructions that software has previously
00753                                                          written into the HNA instruction FIFO (DIF) in main memory. Each HNA instruction contains
00754                                                          a fixed size 64B instruction word which is executed by the HNA hardware. The DBELL field
00755                                                          can hold up to 1M-1 (2^20-1) pending HNA instruction requests. During a software read, the
00756                                                          most recent contents of HNA_DBELL are returned at the time the NCB-INB bus is driven.
00757                                                          NOTE: Since HNA hardware updates this register, its contents are unpredictable in
00758                                                          software. */
00759 #else
00760     uint64_t dbell                        : 20;
00761     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
00762 #endif
00763     } s;
00764     struct cvmx_hna_dbell_s               cn73xx;
00765     struct cvmx_hna_dbell_s               cn78xx;
00766     struct cvmx_hna_dbell_s               cn78xxp1;
00767 };
00768 typedef union cvmx_hna_dbell cvmx_hna_dbell_t;
00769 
00770 /**
00771  * cvmx_hna_difctl
00772  *
00773  * To write to the HNA_DIFCTL register, a device issues an IOBST directed at the HNA with
00774  * addr[34:32]=0x6. To read the HNA_DIFCTL register, a device issues an IOBLD64 directed at the
00775  * HNA with addr[34:32]=0x6.
00776  *
00777  * This register is intended to only be written once (at power-up). Any future writes could cause
00778  * the HNA and FPA hardware to become unpredictable. If HNA_CONFIG[HPUCLKDIS]=1 (HNA-HPU clocks
00779  * disabled), reads/writes to HNA_DIFCTL do not take effect. If the HNA-disable FUSE is blown,
00780  * reads/writes to HNA_DIFCTL do not take effect.
00781  */
00782 union cvmx_hna_difctl {
00783     uint64_t u64;
00784     struct cvmx_hna_difctl_s {
00785 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00786     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
00787     uint64_t aura                         : 16; /**< Represents the 16-bit Aura ID used by HNA hardware when the HNA instruction chunk is
00788                                                          recycled back to the Free Page List maintained by FPA (once the HNA instruction has been
00789                                                          issued). */
00790     uint64_t reserved_13_25               : 13;
00791     uint64_t ldwb                         : 1;  /**< Load don't write back. When set, the hardware issues LDWB command towards the cache when
00792                                                          fetching last word of instructions; as a result the line is not written back when
00793                                                          replaced. When clear, the hardware issues regular load towards cache which will cause the
00794                                                          line to be written back before being replaced. */
00795     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
00796     uint64_t size                         : 9;  /**< Represents the number of 64B instructions contained within each HNA instruction chunk. At
00797                                                          power-on, software seeds the SIZE register with a fixed chunk size (must be at least 3).
00798                                                          HNA hardware uses this field to determine the size of each HNA instruction chunk, in order
00799                                                          to:
00800                                                          a) determine when to read the next HNA instruction chunk pointer which is written by
00801                                                          software at the end of the current HNA instruction chunk (see HNA description of next
00802                                                          chunk buffer Ptr for format).
00803                                                          b) determine when a HNA instruction chunk can be returned to the free page list maintained
00804                                                          by FPA. */
00805 #else
00806     uint64_t size                         : 9;
00807     uint64_t reserved_9_11                : 3;
00808     uint64_t ldwb                         : 1;
00809     uint64_t reserved_13_25               : 13;
00810     uint64_t aura                         : 16;
00811     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
00812 #endif
00813     } s;
00814     struct cvmx_hna_difctl_s              cn73xx;
00815     struct cvmx_hna_difctl_s              cn78xx;
00816     struct cvmx_hna_difctl_s              cn78xxp1;
00817 };
00818 typedef union cvmx_hna_difctl cvmx_hna_difctl_t;
00819 
00820 /**
00821  * cvmx_hna_difrdptr
00822  *
00823  * To write to the HNA_DIFRDPTR register, a device issues an IOBST directed at the HNA with
00824  * addr[34:32] = 0x2 or 0x3. To read the HNA_DIFRDPTR register, a device issues an IOBLD64
00825  * directed at the HNA with addr[34:32] = 0x2 or 0x3.
00826  *
00827  * If HNA_CONFIG[HPUCLKDIS]=1 (HNA-HPU clocks disabled), reads/writes to HNA_DIFRDPTR do not take
00828  * effect. If the HNA-disable fuse is blown, reads/writes to HNA_DIFRDPTR do not take effect.
00829  */
00830 union cvmx_hna_difrdptr {
00831     uint64_t u64;
00832     struct cvmx_hna_difrdptr_s {
00833 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00834     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
00835     uint64_t rdptr                        : 36; /**< Represents the 64B-aligned address of the current instruction in the HNA Instruction FIFO
00836                                                          in main memory. The RDPTR must be seeded by software at boot time, and is then maintained
00837                                                          thereafter by HNA hardware. During the software seed write, [RDPTR][6]=0, since HNA
00838                                                          instruction chunks must be 128B aligned. During a software read, the most recent contents
00839                                                          of [RDPTR] are returned at the time the NCB-INB bus is driven.
00840                                                          NOTE: Since HNA hardware updates this register, its contents are unpredictable in software
00841                                                          (unless it is guaranteed that no new doorbell register writes have occurred and HNA_DBELL
00842                                                          is read as zero). */
00843     uint64_t reserved_0_5                 : 6;
00844 #else
00845     uint64_t reserved_0_5                 : 6;
00846     uint64_t rdptr                        : 36;
00847     uint64_t reserved_42_63               : 22;
00848 #endif
00849     } s;
00850     struct cvmx_hna_difrdptr_s            cn73xx;
00851     struct cvmx_hna_difrdptr_s            cn78xx;
00852     struct cvmx_hna_difrdptr_s            cn78xxp1;
00853 };
00854 typedef union cvmx_hna_difrdptr cvmx_hna_difrdptr_t;
00855 
00856 /**
00857  * cvmx_hna_eco
00858  */
00859 union cvmx_hna_eco {
00860     uint64_t u64;
00861     struct cvmx_hna_eco_s {
00862 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00863     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00864     uint64_t eco_rw                       : 32; /**< Reserved. */
00865 #else
00866     uint64_t eco_rw                       : 32;
00867     uint64_t reserved_32_63               : 32;
00868 #endif
00869     } s;
00870     struct cvmx_hna_eco_s                 cn73xx;
00871     struct cvmx_hna_eco_s                 cn78xx;
00872 };
00873 typedef union cvmx_hna_eco cvmx_hna_eco_t;
00874 
00875 /**
00876  * cvmx_hna_error
00877  *
00878  * This register contains error status information.
00879  *
00880  */
00881 union cvmx_hna_error {
00882     uint64_t u64;
00883     struct cvmx_hna_error_s {
00884 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00885     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
00886     uint64_t hnc_parerr                   : 1;  /**< HNC reported parity error with the response data. */
00887     uint64_t osmerr                       : 1;  /**< OSM reported an error with the response data. */
00888     uint64_t replerr                      : 1;  /**< HNA illegal replication factor error. HNA only supports 1*, 2*, and 4* port replication.
00889                                                          Legal configurations for memory are 2-port or 4-port configurations. The REPLERR interrupt
00890                                                          is set in the following illegal configuration cases:
00891                                                          1) An 8* replication factor is detected for any memory reference.
00892                                                          2) A 4* replication factor is detected for any memory reference when only 2 memory ports
00893                                                          are enabled.
00894                                                          NOTE: If [REPLERR] is set during a HNA graph walk operation, the walk will prematurely
00895                                                          terminate with RWORD0[REA] = ERR. */
00896     uint64_t hnanxm                       : 1;  /**< HNA non-existent memory access. HPUs (and backdoor CSR HNA memory region reads) have
00897                                                          access to the following 40-bit L2/DRAM address space which maps to a 38-bit physical
00898                                                          DDR3/4 SDRAM address space (256 GB max).
00899                                                          DR0: 0x0 0000 0000 0000 to 0x0 0000 0FFF FFFF
00900                                                          maps to lower 256MB of physical DDR3/4 SDRAM.
00901                                                          DR1: 0x0 0000 2000 0000 to 0x0 0020 0FFF FFFF
00902                                                          maps to upper 127.75GB of DDR3/4 SDRAM.
00903                                                          NOTE: the 2nd 256MB hole maps to I/O and is unused (nonexistent) for memory.
00904                                                          In the event the HNA generates a reference to the L2/DRAM address hole (0x0000.0FFF.FFFF -
00905                                                          0x0000.1FFF.FFFF), the HNANXM programmable interrupt bit will be set.
00906                                                          Software Note:
00907                                                          The HNA graph compiler must avoid making references to this 2nd 256MB HOLE which is a non-
00908                                                          existent memory region.
00909                                                          NOTE: If [HNANXM] is set during a HNA graph walk operation, then the walk will prematurely
00910                                                          terminate with RWORD0[REAS]=MEMERR. */
00911     uint64_t dlc1_dbe                     : 1;  /**< A DLC1 response indicated a double-bit ECC error (DBE). */
00912     uint64_t dlc0_dbe                     : 1;  /**< A DLC0 response indicated a double-bit ECC error (DBE). */
00913     uint64_t dlc1_ovferr                  : 1;  /**< DLC1 FIFO overflow error detected. This condition should never architecturally occur, and
00914                                                          is here in case hardware credit/debit scheme is not working. */
00915     uint64_t dlc0_ovferr                  : 1;  /**< DLC0 FIFO overflow error detected. This condition should never architecturally occur, and
00916                                                          is here in case hardware credit/debit scheme is not working. */
00917     uint64_t hnc_ovferr                   : 1;  /**< HNC (RAM1) address overflow error detected.
00918                                                          This condition is signaled by the HPU when an node access is made to RAM1 outside the size
00919                                                          of the RAM. */
00920     uint64_t hna_inst_err                 : 1;  /**< Instruction field ITYPE is not GWALK nor OSM Load. */
00921     uint64_t reserved_6_10                : 5;
00922     uint64_t hpu_pdb_par_err              : 1;  /**< A parity error was detected in a packet data buffer in one of the HNA engines. This is not
00923                                                          self-correcting, and the HPU behavior is undefined. */
00924     uint64_t hpu_rnstck_dbe               : 1;  /**< A double-bit ECC (DBE) error was detected in the run stack of an HPU. This is not self-
00925                                                          correcting, and the HPU behavior is undefined. */
00926     uint64_t hpu_rnstck_sbe               : 1;  /**< A single-bit ECC (SBE) error was detected in the run stack of an HPU. This is self-
00927                                                          correcting, and the HPU should continue to operate normally. */
00928     uint64_t hpu_svstck_dbe               : 1;  /**< A double-bit ECC (DBE) error was detected in the save stack / result buffer of an HPU.
00929                                                          This is not self-correcting, and the HPU behavior is undefined. */
00930     uint64_t hpu_svstck_sbe               : 1;  /**< A single-bit ECC (SBE) error was detected in the save stack / result buffer of an HPU.
00931                                                          This is self-correcting, and the HPU should continue to operate normally. */
00932     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;  /**< Doorbell overflow detected - status bit. When set, the 20-bit accumulated doorbell
00933                                                          register had overflowed (software wrote too many doorbell requests).
00934                                                          NOTE: Detection of a doorbell register overflow is a catastrophic error which may leave
00935                                                          the HNA hardware in an unrecoverable state. */
00936 #else
00937     uint64_t dblovf                       : 1;
00938     uint64_t hpu_svstck_sbe               : 1;
00939     uint64_t hpu_svstck_dbe               : 1;
00940     uint64_t hpu_rnstck_sbe               : 1;
00941     uint64_t hpu_rnstck_dbe               : 1;
00942     uint64_t hpu_pdb_par_err              : 1;
00943     uint64_t reserved_6_10                : 5;
00944     uint64_t hna_inst_err                 : 1;
00945     uint64_t hnc_ovferr                   : 1;
00946     uint64_t dlc0_ovferr                  : 1;
00947     uint64_t dlc1_ovferr                  : 1;
00948     uint64_t dlc0_dbe                     : 1;
00949     uint64_t dlc1_dbe                     : 1;
00950     uint64_t hnanxm                       : 1;
00951     uint64_t replerr                      : 1;
00952     uint64_t osmerr                       : 1;
00953     uint64_t hnc_parerr                   : 1;
00954     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
00955 #endif
00956     } s;
00957     struct cvmx_hna_error_s               cn73xx;
00958     struct cvmx_hna_error_s               cn78xx;
00959     struct cvmx_hna_error_s               cn78xxp1;
00960 };
00961 typedef union cvmx_hna_error cvmx_hna_error_t;
00962 
00963 /**
00964  * cvmx_hna_error_capture_data
00965  *
00966  * This register holds the HPU_STATUS data captured during some HNA_ERROR events.
00967  *
00968  */
00969 union cvmx_hna_error_capture_data {
00970     uint64_t u64;
00971     struct cvmx_hna_error_capture_data_s {
00972 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00973     uint64_t hpu_stat                     : 64; /**< HPU_STATUS data captured during some HNA_ERROR events. It will preserve the HPU_STATUS
00974                                                          from the
00975                                                          first such event that is detected, until the VLD bit in the HNA_ERROR_CAPTURE_INFO
00976                                                          register is reset by clearing the corresponding interrupt. If multiple error events occur
00977                                                          before the VLD bit is cleared, the
00978                                                          subsequent HPU_STATUS information will be lost. The error capture is triggered by the
00979                                                          following error conditions:
00980                                                          * HPU memory errors (SBE or DBE on svstk/rnstk/rwb, or parity error on PDB).
00981                                                          * HNC parity error.
00982                                                          * RAM1 address overflow.
00983                                                          The HPU STATUS format is as follows:
00984                                                          <pre>
00985                                                          [63:60]   0x0
00986                                                          [60:40]   failing address              Last fetched node
00987                                                          [39:36]   0x0
00988                                                          [35:28]   svstck_synd
00989                                                          [27]      svstck_dbe                   Interrupt
00990                                                          [26]      svstck_sbe                   Interrupt
00991                                                          [25:18]   rnstck_synd
00992                                                          [17]      rnstck_dbe                   Interrupt
00993                                                          [16]      rnstck_sbe                   Interrupt
00994                                                          [15:11]   Current opcode
00995                                                          [10]      1'b0
00996                                                          [9]       OSM or DLC Response Error    REASON MEMERR
00997                                                          [8]       Bad node                     REASON BADNODE
00998                                                          [7]       Node in RAM2 / bad entry ID  REASON BADADR
00999                                                          [6]       Bad stack entry              REASON BAD STACKENTRY
01000                                                          [5]       Svstck full                  REASON SVSTACK FULL
01001                                                          [4]       Rwb full                     REASON RWB FULL
01002                                                          [3]       Rnstck full                  REASON RUN STACK FULL
01003                                                          [2]       Packet data parity error     Interrupt
01004                                                          [1]       RAM1 or RAM2 parity error    REASON MEMERR
01005                                                          [0]       Ram1 overflow error          REASON MEMERR
01006                                                          </pre> */
01007 #else
01008     uint64_t hpu_stat                     : 64;
01009 #endif
01010     } s;
01011     struct cvmx_hna_error_capture_data_s  cn73xx;
01012     struct cvmx_hna_error_capture_data_s  cn78xx;
01013     struct cvmx_hna_error_capture_data_s  cn78xxp1;
01014 };
01015 typedef union cvmx_hna_error_capture_data cvmx_hna_error_capture_data_t;
01016 
01017 /**
01018  * cvmx_hna_error_capture_info
01019  *
01020  * This register holds the meta-data for the HPU_STATUS captured during some HNA_ERROR events.
01021  * Upon the first occurrence of select HPU error events, the HPU status is captured in the
01022  * HNA_ERROR_CAPTURE_DATA register.  The cluster and engine ID are captured in this register,
01023  * along with a valid bit.  The valid bit is reset by clearing the corresponding interrupt.  Any
01024  * errors that occur while the valid bit is set will be lost.  The HPU errors that are captured
01025  * are memory errors (DBE, SBE, parity) in the HPU internal RAMs, HNC parity errors, and HNC
01026  * overflow errors.
01027  */
01028 union cvmx_hna_error_capture_info {
01029     uint64_t u64;
01030     struct cvmx_hna_error_capture_info_s {
01031 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01032     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
01033     uint64_t cl_id                        : 2;  /**< Cluster which was the source of the HPU_STATUS. */
01034     uint64_t hpu_id                       : 4;  /**< HPU which was the source of the HPU_STATUS. */
01035     uint64_t reserved_2_3                 : 2;
01036     uint64_t ovf                          : 1;  /**< Reserved. */
01037     uint64_t vld                          : 1;  /**< The VLD bit indicates that an HNA_ERROR has occurred and the HPU_STATUS has been captured
01038                                                          in the HNA_ERROR_CAPTURE_DATA register. The first such HPU_STATUS will be stored until
01039                                                          this bit is reset by clearing one of these interrupts:
01040                                                          * HNA_ERROR_SVSTCK_SBE.
01041                                                          * HNA_ERROR_SVSTCK_DBE.
01042                                                          * HNA_ERROR_RNSTCK_SBE.
01043                                                          * HNA_ERROR_RNSTCK_DBE.
01044                                                          * HNA_ERROR_PDB_PAR_ERR.
01045                                                          * HNA_ERROR_HNC_OVFERR.
01046                                                          * HNA_ERROR_HNC_PARERR. */
01047 #else
01048     uint64_t vld                          : 1;
01049     uint64_t ovf                          : 1;
01050     uint64_t reserved_2_3                 : 2;
01051     uint64_t hpu_id                       : 4;
01052     uint64_t cl_id                        : 2;
01053     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
01054 #endif
01055     } s;
01056     struct cvmx_hna_error_capture_info_s  cn73xx;
01057     struct cvmx_hna_error_capture_info_s  cn78xx;
01058     struct cvmx_hna_error_capture_info_s  cn78xxp1;
01059 };
01060 typedef union cvmx_hna_error_capture_info cvmx_hna_error_capture_info_t;

01168 /**
01169  * cvmx_hna_hpu_dbg
01170  *
01171  * This register specifies the HPU CSR number, cluster number = CLID and HPU number = HPUID used
01172  * during a a CSR read of the HNA_HPU_CSR register.
01173  */
01174 union cvmx_hna_hpu_dbg {
01175     uint64_t u64;
01176     struct cvmx_hna_hpu_dbg_s {
01177 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01178     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01179     uint64_t csrnum                       : 2;  /**< HPU CSR number:
01180                                                          0x0 = HPU_STATUS.
01181                                                          0x1 = DBG_CURSTK.
01182                                                          0x2 = DBG_GENERAL. */
01183     uint64_t clid                         : 2;  /**< Cluster number. Valid range is 0-3. */
01184     uint64_t hpuid                        : 4;  /**< HPU engine ID. Valid range 0-11. */
01185 #else
01186     uint64_t hpuid                        : 4;
01187     uint64_t clid                         : 2;
01188     uint64_t csrnum                       : 2;
01189     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01190 #endif
01191     } s;
01192     struct cvmx_hna_hpu_dbg_s             cn73xx;
01193     struct cvmx_hna_hpu_dbg_s             cn78xx;
01194     struct cvmx_hna_hpu_dbg_s             cn78xxp1;
01195 };
01196 typedef union cvmx_hna_hpu_dbg cvmx_hna_hpu_dbg_t;

01198 /**
01199  * cvmx_hna_hpu_eir
01200  *
01201  * Used by software to force parity or ECC errors on some internal HPU data structures. A CSR
01202  * write of this register forces either a parity or ECC error on the next access at cluster
01203  * number = [CLID], HPU number = [HPUID].
01204  */
01205 union cvmx_hna_hpu_eir {
01206     uint64_t u64;
01207     struct cvmx_hna_hpu_eir_s {
01208 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01209     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
01210     uint64_t wrdone                       : 1;  /**< When HNA_HPU_EIR is written, this bit is cleared by hardware. When the targeted HPU has
01211                                                          received the error injection command (i.e. error injection armed), [WRDONE] is set.
01212                                                          Software first writes HNA_HPU_EIR, then does a polling read of [WRDONE] (until it
01213                                                          becomes 1), before issuing an HNA instruction to the targeted HPU which will inject the
01214                                                          intended error type for a single occurrence (one-shot). */
01215     uint64_t pdperr                       : 1;  /**< Packet data buffer parity error. Forces parity error on next packet data buffer read. */
01216     uint64_t svflipsyn                    : 2;  /**< Save stack flip syndrome control. Forces 1-bit/2-bit errors on next save stack read. */
01217     uint64_t rsflipsyn                    : 2;  /**< Run stack flip syndrome control. Forces 1-bit/2-bit errors on next run stack read. */
01218     uint64_t clid                         : 2;  /**< HPC cluster number. Valid range is 0-3. */
01219     uint64_t hpuid                        : 4;  /**< HPU engine ID. Valid range is 0-11. */
01220 #else
01221     uint64_t hpuid                        : 4;
01222     uint64_t clid                         : 2;
01223     uint64_t rsflipsyn                    : 2;
01224     uint64_t svflipsyn                    : 2;
01225     uint64_t pdperr                       : 1;
01226     uint64_t wrdone                       : 1;
01227     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
01228 #endif
01229     } s;
01230     struct cvmx_hna_hpu_eir_s             cn73xx;
01231     struct cvmx_hna_hpu_eir_s             cn78xx;
01232     struct cvmx_hna_hpu_eir_s             cn78xxp1;
01233 };
01234 typedef union cvmx_hna_hpu_eir cvmx_hna_hpu_eir_t;

01437 /**
01438  * cvmx_hna_pfc_gctl
01439  *
01440  * Global control across all performance counters.
01441  *
01442  */
01443 union cvmx_hna_pfc_gctl {
01444     uint64_t u64;
01445     struct cvmx_hna_pfc_gctl_s {
01446 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01447     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
01448     uint64_t cnt3rclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 3 read clear. If this bit is set, CSR reads to the HNA_PFC3_CNT will
01449                                                          clear the count value. This allows software to maintain 'cumulative' counters to avoid
01450                                                          hardware wraparound. */
01451     uint64_t cnt2rclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 2 read clear. If this bit is set, CSR reads to the HNA_PFC2_CNT will
01452                                                          clear the count value. This allows software to maintain 'cumulative' counters to avoid
01453                                                          hardware wraparound. */
01454     uint64_t cnt1rclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 1 read clear. If this bit is set, CSR reads to the HNA_PFC1_CNT will
01455                                                          clear the count value. This allows software to maintain 'cumulative' counters to avoid
01456                                                          hardware wraparound. */
01457     uint64_t cnt0rclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 0 read clear. If this bit is set, CSR reads to the HNA_PFC0_CNT will
01458                                                          clear the count value. This allows software to maintain 'cumulative' counters to avoid
01459                                                          hardware wraparound. */
01460     uint64_t cnt3wclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 3 write clear. If this bit is set, CSR writes to the HNA_PFC3_CNT will
01461                                                          clear the count value. If this bit is clear, CSR writes to the HNA_PFC3_CNT will continue
01462                                                          the count from the written value. */
01463     uint64_t cnt2wclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 2 write clear. If this bit is set, CSR writes to the HNA_PFC2_CNT will
01464                                                          clear the count value. If this bit is clear, CSR writes to the HNA_PFC2_CNT will continue
01465                                                          the count from the written value. */
01466     uint64_t cnt1wclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 1 write clear. If this bit is set, CSR writes to the HNA_PFC1_CNT will
01467                                                          clear the count value. If this bit is clear, CSR writes to the HNA_PFC1_CNT will continue
01468                                                          the count from the written value. */
01469     uint64_t cnt0wclr                     : 1;  /**< Performance counter 0 write clear. If this bit is set, CSR writes to the HNA_PFC0_CNT will
01470                                                          clear the count value. If this bit is clear, CSR writes to the HNA_PFC0_CNT will continue
01471                                                          the count from the written value. */
01472     uint64_t cnt3ena                      : 1;  /**< Performance counter 3 enable. When this bit is set, the performance counter 3 is enabled. */
01473     uint64_t cnt2ena                      : 1;  /**< Performance counter 2 enable. When this bit is set, the performance counter 2 is enabled. */
01474     uint64_t cnt1ena                      : 1;  /**< Performance counter 1 enable. When this bit is set, the performance counter 1 is enabled. */
01475     uint64_t cnt0ena                      : 1;  /**< Performance counter 0 enable. When this bit is set, the performance counter 0 is enabled. */
01476 #else
01477     uint64_t cnt0ena                      : 1;
01478     uint64_t cnt1ena                      : 1;
01479     uint64_t cnt2ena                      : 1;
01480     uint64_t cnt3ena                      : 1;
01481     uint64_t cnt0wclr                     : 1;
01482     uint64_t cnt1wclr                     : 1;
01483     uint64_t cnt2wclr                     : 1;
01484     uint64_t cnt3wclr                     : 1;
01485     uint64_t cnt0rclr                     : 1;
01486     uint64_t cnt1rclr                     : 1;
01487     uint64_t cnt2rclr                     : 1;
01488     uint64_t cnt3rclr                     : 1;
01489     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
01490 #endif
01491     } s;
